Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2015 11:36PM SueBe wrote: Barremom you look great! We started cc'ing at the same time, same day I think. I often think about my cohort. I am almost 9 weeks PFC and still shedding. No bald spots, and the area that thinned a lot is not covered by gray hair. I have to get a cut soon. I am scared about coloring it. Maybe I'll try henna.

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2015 03:49AM SueBe wrote: HockeyCat that's great news. I am still shedding. I washed my hair today and they are still falling out. Hopefully it will end this week.
Posts.Title: Life After Cold Caps: a place for ex-cold-cappers to share OneTexasDay angiepie

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2015 07:22PM SueBe wrote: Hi everyone! I am now 20 weeks since my last treatment. I have an inch of new growth in those areas where I thinned out a lot. I am quite happy that when I put my hair back in a small pony tail I look normal. My only concern is that my part is wider than before chemo. I am wondering if this will change. I don't know why there is no new hair in the front of my head, like in the back and sides. I am still shedding about 75-100 strands of hair a day. I think I am unusual in shedding so long. It has stabilized to 75-100, but still wondering where all these long hairs are coming from and how it is possible I still have any left for a small ponytail. I am on Arimidex and maybe that's why I am shedding more than others here. I started taking biotin 5,000 mg. Haven't seen too much of a change.

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2015 06:38PM SueBe wrote: Thanks hope49 and HockeyCat! I washed my hair again today and cut about an 1" myself. I couldn't stand the wispy ends just hanging there. I looks so much better. I can't believe I did this myself, but it turned out well. I guess having less hair makes it easier to cut. I can't wait to get back to normal hair routines!

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2015 09:45AM SueBe wrote: Thanks for the info HockeyCat. I do hope the shedding is going down for you and stopping soon. I have tried the Nioxin 4 and it made a big difference for me. I didn't have a shedding scalp problem so didn't leave shampoo in for too long. I noticed the shedding was less and my hair just looked a lot fuller. I used the conditioner too but didn't massage it into my scalp. I am feeling a lot better about the hair thinning after using it.

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2015 10:32AM SueBe wrote: HockeyCat, how is your hair holding up after getting it cut and colored? I thought I read above that you were doing that. My hair finally stopped shedding, and this is five months PFC. It is coming in in the back and sides really well but now the front where my part is the scalp is showing through the hair. I have scheduled a haircut for the 13th. I am using phyto, and Nioxin 4 shampoo and conditioner. I am also taking biotin.

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2015 02:56PM SueBe wrote: I was wondering, for those of us who were still shedding PFC, did it stop all at once or was it a gradual slow down to then stopping all together? I am 13 weeks out and still shedding. Hair is so much thinner now but growing in. No one I just meet thinks "chemo" when they see me. So it was really worth still worth it for me. I am putting my hair in a small ponytail and using a headband to keep it all in place. Do you guys have other styling suggestions? Wearing it down is really not possible. The hair is right past my shoulders. I have basically four clumps hanging there and curling in on themselves. Can't wait to get it cut into a bob.
